lincus.name: Lincus
lincus.brief: Lincus is a startup, whose flasgship product is a search engine for expertise. The identity was designed to reflect the idea of interconnection, while invoking a sense of community and intellectualism. The app is presently in beta, and has already been licensed to Yale University and UMass Amherst.

c3p.name: Close Third Person
c3p.brief: An identity for the UConn 2018 Master of Fine Arts Exhibition. The sliding mark and overlapping graphics speak to shifting perspectives and proximities; a subdued, philosophical dance that guided each graduate during their time at the University.

hr.name: HYPERREAL
hr.scope: Silkscreen posters, Book, Mobile Web App, 3D
hr.brief: HYPERREAL explores how digital technology shapes our understanding of reality. The project consists of several experiments that address the duality of modern existence: physicality (real) and intangibility (hyperreal). The experiments are intended to invoke questions as the viewer experiences and interacts with them. HYPERREAL intends to illuminate aspects of our lives which are new, complex, and only partially understood, yet often overlooked and easily accepted.

slabs.name: [squared labs]
slabs.brief: [squared labs] provides design services and bespoke web based tools to support research at the University of Connecticut. The mark's design speaks to the kinetic, possibility-rich nature of the space. The ‘⬚’ provides an area for activation, while the monospaced type of the wordmark harkens to software based origin of the group.

pgc.name: Plants & Global Change Research Lab
pgc.brief: The Plant & Global Change Research Lab researches plant life in the context of global warming and climate change. The central wave of the mark is representative of the yearly upward trend in atmospheric carbon dioxide concentration, known as the Keeling Curve. The acronym emerging from the wave invokes the intersection of plant biology and global change, while also providing potential for future activation.

sl.name: Seemann Lab
sl.brief: A website for the laboratory of Jeff Seemann, a distinguished researcher, professor, and administrator at the University of Connecticut.

ose.name: Open Source Everything
ose.brief: A series of posters for the Open Source Everything manifesto, which purports a society built around truth, transparency, and trust. The posters illustrate the importance of these ethos by obfuscating and obscuring information. Each reflects one of the three main paradigms of computing: the mainframe, the cloud, and edge computing. Accompanying the posters is a US English QWERTY keyboard cover (screen printed) with binary encoded lowercase characters. By altering the primary interface between human and machine, the piece contextualizes thought, input, and screens with the information stored on hard drives.

fdfo.name: Further Down & Farther Out
fdfo.brief: Perturbed by the homelessness epidemic that I witnessed for the first time while living in London, I made a ‘walking tour’ that forces participants to recognize the homeless as they travel the city. My intent was to humanize the displaced; to bring their personalities, histories, and lives to the forefront of people's minds. The tour is designed to be taken while audio recordings of conversations between myself and displaced individuals are listened to through headphones. The accompanying book is a retrospective on one such conversation.

ibqap.name: It’s Been Quite a Process
ibqap.brief: It’s Been Quite a Process is a collation of notes, sketches, iterations, feedback, and responses of each project undertaken while at CSM. The book was handmade in an edition of two, printed on 95GSM STARWHITE Sirius paper with a 175GSM Plike paper cover, which sports carbon transferred type.

abuse.name: Abusability
abuse.brief: Abusability focused on manipulating physical media to create unique graphic styles and systems. I set out to explore how drastic scale changes affect media that are designed to be static. I decorated balloons with numerous substances: acrylic paint, spray paint, screen printed plastisol ink, markers, and more. Once decorated, the balloons were inflated, then rapidly deflated. Each application was thoroughly documented with an alpha-numeric ID system. The resulting set of complex textures and otherwordly landscapes were extracted into a graphic language.

groove.name: GROOVE Recording
groove.brief: GROOVE Recording is the project of a seasoned performing and studio musician throwing his hat into the online music production ring. In order to stand out in a saturated, cut-and-dry market, the brand seeks to be eye catching, engaging, and memorable by creating a living system for the mark.
